intro: Pedicularis yaoshanensis, commonly known as the Yaoshan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
